item.title: Open? When Site Restrictions and Clauses Undermine Open Access
item.description: Open access publishing has transformed the way research circulates. In principle, open access means that anyone, anywhere, can read and reuse scholarly work without financial, legal, or technical barriers. But in practice, many works labeled as "open" are quietly constrained by restrictions that limit how they can be used, especially by machines.
